body.p: The following is a list of hardware and setup items you must consider before beginning the installation.

ol.li: Note that all disks on the system(s) will be wiped
The machine types should be homogeneous.
Gather MAC addresses and IP addresses you wish to assign

Install on nodes via legacy bios setting. If you have UEFI instead of a BIOS, you need to switch to legacy BIOS setting. If using HP hardware, you can make these changes in the iLO console in system utilities | BIOS/Platform Configuration | boot options. Otherwise use you IPMI management console or command-line interface (CLI). Advanced iLO license needed to use the iLO console for advanced configurations. Otherwise use the command line.

Array configuration: In HPSAA HP Smart Storage Adminstrator, configure the logcal volume setup.
Deployer needs no partitions. Can create a single logical disk from all available disks on deployer node with RAID 5 configuration if desired.
Four local disks on nodes in the control plane (for root OS and Swift) are required.
Swift cannot currently use logical volumes
Need to enable PXE booting. Adjust boot order for the control plane and storage nodes. For deployer node this can be CD ROM with hard drives last.
Synchronize the time on all nodes manually
